media.caption: Minnesota Environmental Policy Act

text.headline: Project Environment Foundation
text.text: Project Environment Foundation (PEF) was formed by the North Star Chapter of the Sierra Club. PEF sued to stop logging of virgin forests in the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness PEF successfully lobbied for passage of the Minnesota Environmental Policy Act (МЕРA).

media.credit: United States Library of Congress's Prints and Photographs division

text.headline: Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness Act of 1978
text.text: PEF successfuly lobbied for passage of the BWCA Wilderness Act following years of litigation and administrative action. The act was signed into law by President Jimmy Carter on October 21, 1978.

media.credit: Minnesota Center for Environmental Advocacy Logo

text.headline: MCEA 50th Anniversary Timeline
text.text: For 50 years, we’ve worked in the courts, at the legislature, and with public agencies to enact, strengthen, and enforce smart environmental law. We educate the public about environmental issues and support communities in their fight to protect their environment, especially where people are disproportionally impacted by pollution and social inequities.
